message:
Hi guys. I am working in project that has two databases Redis and MySQL.  
the scenario : MySQl will generate row with id  then i will put it in Redis.
Then status of the row will be changed in Redis  after that row's status will br changed  again then  update Mysql.

issue: how to keep data validated in both?

data.message: أرجو إنك تجد إجابة، لكن كان لي استفسار، ايه هي الفايدة من استخدام Redis؟

الاتنين بيقوموا ينفس المهمة. ليه هم الاتنين ؟؟؟
What do you mean with Data Validation?  Where does the data come from?

I don't think you can achieve absolutely 100% guarantee of consistency without building a whole auditing system, like having every change logged from all different applications and systems and a background service goes trough these logs and makes sure every change is persisted across the systems, and even with that you would achieve an "Eventually Consistent" system.

We have multiple products that run on top of multiple database and believe me it's too complicated to keep both synchronized with no redundancy :) Maybe my comment is not so helpful but don't use 2 databases unless you really really deeply need it :)

Thank you for your help.
